description: The upsStatusChange trap indicates that the sending
agent monitor detected a change in the status of the external
tests: $SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsStatusChange PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsConnectedStatus i 2 PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsLinePowerStatus i 1 PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsBatteryStorageStatus i 2 PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsInternalStatus i 1
$SNMPTRAPCMD PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsStatusChange PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsConnectedStatus i 1 PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsLinePowerStatus i 1 PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsBatteryStorageStatus i 1 PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsInternalStatus i 1

description: This object indicates, if a UPS is connected to the device.
variables.name: PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsConnectedStatus

description: This object indicates the external AD power line status:
the UPS is supplying the power from the internal battery
or from an external AC power connection.
variables.name: PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsLinePowerStatus

description: This object shows the estimated time left until the UPS battery
will discharge to the level at which the UPS must shutdown.
variables.name: PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsBatteryStorageStatus

description: This object shows if the UPS has some kind of an internal
variables.name: PRVT-UPS-MIB::upsInternalStatus
